required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Anti-inflammatory Diet Effect on Metabolic, Inflammatory and Immune Status of Obese Younger Adults
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of an Anti-Inflammatory Diet on Weight Loss, Body Composition, Cardiometabolic Risk Factors and Immune System Response in Younger Adults

brief_summary.textblock: Diet has a major role in the etiology of obesity, and there is a growing body of evidence suggesting that a variety of dietary factors can modulate obesity-induced chronic low-grade inflammation and thus the course of obesity-related chronic non-communicable diseases. The present intervention study aims to evaluate the effect of an anti-inflammatory diet on weight loss, body composition, cardiometabolic risk factors and immune system response among young adults of the obese younger adults.

detailed_description.textblock: Obesity pandemic presents a major challenge to chronic disease prevention worldwide. A low-grade chronic inflammation is associated with obesity and related cardiometabolic disorders, such as cardiovascular diseases, type 2 diabetes and some type of cancers. Diet has a major role in the etiology of obesity, and there is a growing body of evidence suggesting that a variety of dietary factors can modulate obesity-induced chronic low-grade inflammation and thus the course of obesity-related chronic non-communicable diseases. The present intervention study aims to evaluate the effect of an anti-Inflammatory diet on weight loss, body composition, cardiometabolic risk factors and immune system response among younger adults. A nutritional intervention based on an energy-restricted anti-inflammatory diet will be compared with an isocaloric standard diet (55-60% carbohydrates, 25% fat, 15-20% protein). The inflammatory potential of the diet will be assessed with the Dietary Inflammatory Index®.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The randomized controlled intervention study. A nutritional intervention will be based on an energy-restricted anti-inflammatory diet that will be compared with an isocaloric standard diet (55-60% carbohydrates, 25% fat, 15-20% protein).

primary_outcome.measure: The changes in the body mass index
primary_outcome.description: body mass index (kg/m2) calculated from measured body weight (kg) and height (m)

primary_outcome.measure: The changes in the waist circumference
primary_outcome.description: waist circumference (cm) measured with measuring tape
fat mass (kg) measured with bioelectric impedance analyzer
fat-free mass (kg) measured with bioelectric impedance analyzer

primary_outcome.measure: The changes of skeletal muscle mass
primary_outcome.description: skeletal muscle mass (kg) measured with bioelectric impedance analyzer

primary_outcome.measure: The changes of visceral adipose tissue
primary_outcome.description: visceral adipose tissue (l) measured with bioelectric impedance analyzer

secondary_outcome.measure: The changes in fasting glucose concentration

secondary_outcome.description: concentration of insulin (pmol/l) and glucose (mmol/l) for calculation of HOMA-index: HOMA - IR = (insulin (mU/l) x glucose (mmol/l)) / 22,5

secondary_outcome.measure: The changes in serum lipid profile
secondary_outcome.description: concentration of fasting triglycerides (mmol/l), HDL (mmol/l), LDL (mmol/l), total cholesterol (mmol/l)

secondary_outcome.measure: The changes in serum liver transaminases concentration
secondary_outcome.description: concentration of serum fasting liver transaminases (AST (U/l), ALT (U/l), GGT (U/l), ALP (U/l))

secondary_outcome.measure: The changes in serum IL-beta, IL-6 and TNF-alpha concentrations
secondary_outcome.description: concentration of serum IL-1 beta (pg/ml), IL-6 (pg/ml), TNF-alpha (pg/ml)

secondary_outcome.measure: The changes in serum hs-C-reactive protein concentration
The changes of blood lymphocytes T and lymphocite subgroups count
secondary_outcome.description: count of blood lymphocytes T, lymphocyte subgroups (TCD3, TCD4, TCD8, BCD19, NKCs, Tregs (CD4+CD25+Foxp3+))

secondary_outcome.measure: The changes in thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) concentration
The changes in free tri-iodothyronine (fT3) concentration
The changes in free thyroxine (fT4) concentration
secondary_outcome.description: concentration of fT4 (pmol/l) and thyroid peroxidase antibodies concentration (IU/l)

secondary_outcome.measure: The changes in thyroid peroxidase antibodies (TPOAbs) concentration

arm_group.description: energy-reduced diet with the use of low glycemic foods, wholegrain products, legumes, colorful vegetables and fruit, nuts, seeds, marine fish, olive oil, green/black tea, and multiple spices and herbs
isocaloric to anti-inflammatory diet, energy restricted diet (55-60% carbohydrates, 25% fat, 15-20% protein) used in a standard obesity management

intervention.description: During 6 months the participants will we asked to use recommended energy-reduced diet with anti-inflammatory properties, based on colorful vegetables and fruits, legumes, nuts, seeds, marine fish, whole-grain products, and daily use of olive oil, green/black tea, multiple spices and herbs.
During 6 months the participants of control group will be asked to use recommended energy-reduced diet based on standard obesity management (55-60% carbohydrates, 25% fat, 15-20% protein)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adults age of 18 to 50 years
- body mass index ≥ 30 kg/m2
- with or without obesity related complications
Exclusion Criteria:
- smoking
- chronic hearth, renal and/or liver diseases,
- active carcinoma or having carcinoma in last year
- anti-inflammatory and/or immunosuppressive drugs intake
- changing the existing medication therapy
- persons older than 50 years
- active infection and/or surgical procedure in last 3 months
- nutritive allergy or intolerance to any anti-inflammatory diet constituent
- pregnancy

overall_official.affiliation: University of Rijeka, Faculty of Medicine
Teaching Institute of Public Health of Primorsko-goranska County

patient_data.ipd_description: We planned to share the statistical analysis results of the study, after the study will be completed and published.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: The data will be available one year after ending of the study for an year.
